data.quote: Histories make men wise  poets  witty  the mathematics  subtile  natural philosophy  deep  morals  grave  logic and rhetoric  able to contend.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: There are more men ennobled by study than by nature.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: The world's great men have not commonly been great scholars  nor its great scholars great men.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: As turning the logs will make a dull fire burn  so change of studies a dull brain.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: You are in some brown study.
data.author: John Lyly

data.quote: Iron sharpens iron  scholar  the scholar.
data.author: Talmud

data.quote: We are growing serious  and  let me tell you  that's a very next step to being dull.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: The bookful blockhead  ignorantly read  With loads of learned lumber in his head.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Against stupidity the very gods Themselves contend in vain.
data.author: Friedrich von Schiller

data.quote: One who uses many periods is a philosopher  many interrogations  a student  many exclamations  a fanatic.
data.author: J. L. Basford

data.quote: Style is the dress of thoughts.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: Montesquieu had the style of a genius  Buffon  the genius of style.
data.author: Baron Grimm

data.quote: Neat  not gaudy.
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: Lxnig sentences in a short composition are like large rooms in a little house.
data.author: William Shenstone

data.quote: You gain strength  courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.... You must do the thing you think you cannot do.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: If you banish fear  nothing terribly bad can happen to you.
data.author: Margaret Bourke-White

data.quote: I believe that anyone can conquer fear by doing the things he fears to do  provided he keeps doing them until he gets a record of successful experiences behind him.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: When in fear  it is safest to force the attack.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: The way to develop self-confidence is to do the thing you fear  and get a record of successful experiences behind you.
data.author: William Jennings Bryan

data.quote: He that fleeth from the fear shall fall into the pit.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: To live with fear and not be afraid is the final test of maturity.
data.author: Edward Weeks

data.quote: Constant exposure to dangers will breed contempt for them.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: To do anything in this world worth doing  we must not stand back shivering and thinking of the cold and danger  but jump in and scramble through as well as we can.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: Do the thing you fear  and the death of fear is certain.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I wanted to be scared again ... I wanted to feel unsure again. That's the only way I learn  the only way I feel challenged.
data.author: Connie Chung

data.quote: You cannot run away from a weakness. You must sometimes fight it out or perish  and if that be so  why not now  and where you stand?
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Often I have found that the one thing that can save is the thing which appears most to threaten ... one has to go down into what one most fears and in that process ... comes a saving flicker of light and energy that  even if it does not produce the courage of a hero  at any rate enables a trembling mortal to take one step further.
data.author: Laurens Van der Post

data.quote: I was afraid to write Fear of Flying  ergo  I had to write it. I have lived my life according to this principle: If I'm afraid of it  then I must do it.
data.author: Erica Jong

data.quote: One ought never to turn one's back on a threatened danger and try to run away from it. If you do that  you will double the danger. But if you meet it promptly and without flinching  you will reduce the danger by half. Never run away from anything. Never!
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Being "brave" means doing or facing something frightening. ... Being "fearless" means being without fear.
data.author: Penelope Leach

data.quote: From a distance it is something  and nearby it is nothing.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: What you are afraid to do is a clear indicator of the next thing you need to do.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: He that is afraid to shake the dice will never throw a six.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: The most drastic  and usually the most effective  remedy for fear is direct action.
data.author: William Burnham

data.quote: To be busy with material affairs is the best preservative against reflection  fears  doubts.... I suppose a fellow proposing to cut his throat would experience a sort of relief while occupied in stropping his razor carefully.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: I think we should follow a simple rule: if we can take the worst  take the risk.
data.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

data.quote: Happiness is to take up the struggle in the midst of the raging storm  not to pluck the lute in the moonlight or recite poetry among the blossoms.
data.author: Ding Ling

data.quote: Winners take chances. Like everyone else  they fear failing  but they refuse to let fear control them.
data.author: Nancy Simms

data.quote: Many of our fears are tissuepaper-thin  and a single courageous step would carry us clear through them.
data.author: Brendan Francis

data.quote: The habit of doing one's duty drives away fear.
data.author: Charles Baudelaire

data.quote: Become so wrapped up in something that you forget to be afraid.
data.author: Lady Bird Johnson

data.quote: Things done well and with care exempt themselves from fear.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Ultimately we know deeply that the other side of every fear is freedom.
data.author: Marilyn Ferguson

data.quote: One had to take some action against fear when once it laid hold of one.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: Too busy with the crowded hour to fear to live or die.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: A life of action and danger moderates the dread of death. It not only gives us fortitude to bear pain  but teaches us at every step the precarious tenure on which we hold our present being.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: If you want to conquer fear  don't sit at home and think about it. Go out and get busy.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: Half our fears are baseless  the other half discreditable.
data.author: Christian Bovee

data.quote: We poison our lives with fear of burglary and shipwreck and ... the house is never burgled  and the ship never goes down.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: To relinquish a present good through apprehension of a future evil is in most instances unwise ... from a fear which may afterwards turn out groundless  you lost the good that lay within your grasp.
data.author: Francesco Guicciardini

data.quote: Envy and fear are the only passions to which no pleasure is attached.
data.author: John Churton Collins

data.quote: There is often less danger in the things we fear than in the things we desire.
data.author: John Churton Collins

data.quote: Needless fear and panic over disease or misfortune that seldom materialize are simply bad habits. By proper ventilation and illumination of the mind it is possible to cultivate tolerance  poise and real courage.
data.author: Elie Metchnikoff

data.quote: There are very few monsters who warrant the fear we have of them.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: When thinking won't cure fear  action will.
data.author: W Clement Stone

data.quote: Above all things  never be afraid. The enemy who forces you to retreat is himself afraid of you at that very moment.
data.author: Andre Maurois

data.quote: Every great batter works on the theory that the pitcher is more afraid of him than he is of the pitcher.
data.author: Ty Cobb

data.quote: The superpowers often behave like two heavily armed blind men feeling their way around a room  each believing himself in mortal peril from the other  whom he assumes to have perfect vision.
data.author: Henry Kissinger

data.quote: General Grant had a simple  childlike recipe for meeting life ... "I am terribly afraid  but the other fellow is afraid  too."
data.author: Sherwood Anderson

data.quote: If you knew how cowardly your enemy is  you would slap him. Bravery is knowledge of the cowardice in the enemy.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: Mountains appear more lofty the nearer they are approached  but great men resemble them not in this particular.
data.author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

data.quote: I have found adventure in flying  in world travel  in business  and even close at hand. ... Adventure is a state of mind-and spirit. It comes with faith  for with complete faith there is no fear of what faces you in life or death.
data.author: Jacqueline Cochran

data.quote: There is much in the world to make us afraid. There is much more in our faith to make us unafraid.
data.author: Frederick W Cropp

data.quote: Deep faith eliminates fear.
data.author: Lech Walesa

data.quote: Fear knocked at the door. Faith answered. And lo  no one was there.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A perfect faith would lift us absolutely above fear.
data.author: George Macdonald

data.quote: If fear is cultivated it will become stronger. If faith is cultivated it will achieve the mastery ... faith is the stronger emotion because it is positive  whereas fear is negative.
data.author: John Paul Jones

data.quote: Fear imprisons  faith liberates  fear paralyzes  faith empowers  fear disheartens  faith encourages  fear sickens  faith heals  fear makes useless  faith makes serviceable.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: Fear is faith that it won't work out.
data.author: Sister Mary Tricky

data.quote: Fear is the absence of faith.
data.author: Paul Tillich

data.quote: Faith in yourself and faith in God are the key to mastery of fear.
data.author: Harold Sherman

data.quote: God is our refuge and strength  a very present help in trouble. Therefore we will not fear.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I will not fear  for you are ever with me  and you will never leave me to face my perils alone.
data.author: Thomas Merton

data.quote: Fear is faithlessness.
data.author: George Macdonald

data.quote: I stopped believing in Santa Claus when I was six. Mother took me to see him in a department store and he asked for my autograph.
data.author: Shirley Temple

data.quote: Nothing recedes like success.
data.author: Walter Winchell

data.quote: Perseverance  n.: A lowly virtue whereby mediocrity achieves a glorious success.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Success for the striver washes away the effort of striving.
data.author: Pindar

data.quote: The penalty of success is to be bored by people who used to snub you.
data.author: Nancy, Lady Astor

data.quote: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: There are few successful adults who were not first successful children.
data.author: Alexander Chase

data.quote: What is success? To laugh often and much  To win the respect of intelligent people and the affection of children  To earn the appreciation of honest critics and endure the betrayal of false friends  To appreciate beauty  To find the best in others  To leave the world a bit better  whether by a healthy child  a garden patch or a redeemed social condition  To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived  That is to have succeeded.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams  and endeavours to live the life which he has imagined  he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: The world belongs to the enthusiast who keeps cool.
data.author: William McFee

data.quote: Out of every fruition of success  no matter what  comes forth something to make a new effort necessary.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: Though a tree grow ever so high  the falling leaves return to the root.
data.author: Malay proverb

data.quote: Success is that old ABC- ability  breaks and courage.
data.author: Charles Luckman

data.quote: How can they say my life isn't a success? Have I not for more than sixty years got enough to eat and escaped being eaten?
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: You always pass failure on the way to success.
data.author: Mickey Rooney

data.quote: Of course there is no formula for success except perhaps  an unconditional acceptance of life and what it brings.
data.author: Artur Rubinstein

data.quote: High station in life is earned by the gallantry with which appalling experiences are survived with grace.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: Everything bows to success  even grammar.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Never having been able to succeed in the world  he took his revenge by speaking ill of it.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: The successful people are the ones who think up things for the rest of the world to keep busy at.
data.author: Don Marquis

data.quote: It is no use saying 'we are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Survival is triumph enough.
data.author: Harry Crews

data.quote: It takes time to be a success  but time is all it takes.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: There is a passion for perfection which you will rarely see fully developed  but you may note this fact  that in successful lives it is never wholly lacking.
data.author: Bliss Carman

data.quote: Nothing fails like success  nothing is so defeated as yesterday's triumphant cause.
data.author: Phyllis McGinley

data.quote: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success.
data.author: Irving Berlin

data.quote: Nothing fails like success because we don't learn from it. We learn only from failure.
data.author: Kenneth Boulding

data.quote: Get place and wealth  if possible with grace  If not  by any means get wealth and place.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Success is not so much what you are  but rather what you appear to be.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I cannot give you the formula for success  but I can give you the formula for failure  which is - try to please everybody.
data.author: Herbert Bayard Swope

data.quote: Success has made failures of many men.
data.author: Cindy Adams

data.quote: A successful man is he who receives a great deal from his fellow men  usually incomparably more than corresponds to his service to them. The value of a man  however  should be seen in what he gives and not in what he is able to receive.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Success is not the result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
data.author: Reggie Leach

data.quote: Success is the progressive realization of a worthy ideal.
data.author: Earl Nightingale

data.quote: A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: Failure changes for the better  success for the worse.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: Behind every successful man there's a lot of unsuccessful years.
data.author: Bob Brown

data.quote: If people knew what they had to do to be successful  most people wouldn't.
data.author: Lord Thomson of Fleet

data.quote: The secret of all victory lies in the organization of the non-obvious.
data.author: Oswald Spengler

data.quote: Snowflakes are one of nature's most fragile things  but just look what they can do when they stick together.
data.author: Vesta M. Kelly

data.quote: Damon Runyon. A day-coach boy in a parlor car seat.
data.author: Damon Runyon

data.quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
data.author: Christopher Morley

data.quote: Find a need and fill it.
data.author: Ruth Stafford Peale

data.quote: The successful person is the individual who forms the habit of doing what the failing person doesn't like to do.
data.author: Donald Riggs

data.quote: The victory of success is half done when one gains the habit of work.
data.author: Sarah Knowles Bolton

data.quote: The secret of every man who has ever been successful lies in the fact that he formed the bait of doing those things that failures don't like to do.
data.author: A. Jackson King

data.quote: Nature gave men two ends-one to sit on  and one to think with. Ever since then man's success or failure has been dependent on the one he used most.
data.author: George R. Kirkpatrick

data.quote: Make yourself indispensable and you'll be moved up. Act as if you're indispensable and you'll be moved out.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: What is the recipe for successful achievement? To my mind there are just four essential ingredients: Choose a career you love. ... Give it the best there is in you.... Seize your opportunities. ... And be a member of the team.
data.author: Benjamin F. Fairless

data.quote: Vacillating people seldom succeed. They seldom win the solid respect of their fellows. Successful men and women are very careful in reaching decisions  and very persistent and determined in action thereafter.
data.author: L. G. Elliott

data.quote: Many people have the ambition to succeed  they may even have a special aptitude for their job. And yet they do not move ahead. Why? Perhaps they think that since they can master the job  there is no need to master themselves.
data.author: John Stevenson

data.quote: I've been polite and I've always shown up. Somebody asked me if I had any advice for young people entering the business. I said: "Yeah  show up."
data.author: Tom T. Hall

data.quote: The wise man puts all his eggs in one basket and watches the basket.
data.author: Andrew Carnegie

data.quote: I know the price of success: dedication  hard work and an unremitting devotion to the things you want to see happen.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: Success is that old ABC-Ability  Breaks and Courage.
data.author: Charles Luckman

data.quote: The secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams  and endeavors to live the life which he has imaged  he will meet with success unexpected in common hours.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Before everything else  getting ready is the secret of success.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: To be ambitious for wealth  and yet always expecting to be poor  to be always doubting your ability to get what you long for  is like trying to reach east by traveling west. There is no philosophy which will help man to succeed when he is always doubting his ability to do so  and thus attracting failure. No matter how hard you work for success  if your thought is saturated with the fear of failure  it will kill your efforts  neutralize your endeavors and make success impossible.
data.author: Charles Baudouin

data.quote: I cannot give you the formula for success  but I can give you the formula for failure  which is-try to please everybody.
data.author: Herbert Bayard Swope

data.quote: We may fail of our happiness  strive we ever so bravely  but we are less likely to fail if we measure with judgement our chances and our capabilities.
data.author: Agnes Repplier

data.quote: A double-minded man is unstable in all his ways.... A determinate purpose in life and a steady adhesion to it through all disadvantages are indispensable conditions of success.
data.author: William M. Punshion

data.quote: The conditions of conquest are always easy. We have but to toil awhile  endure awhile  believe always  and never turn back.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: The very first step towards success in any occupation is to become interested in it.
data.author: Sir William Osier

data.quote: I studied the lives of great men and famous women  and I found that the men and women who got to the top were those who did the jobs they had in hand  with everything they had of energy and enthusiasm and hard work.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: Without ambition one starts nothing. Without work one finishes nothing. The prize will not be sent to you. As to methods there may be a million and then some  but the principles are few. The man who grasps principles can successfully select his own methods. The man who tries methods  ignoring principles  is sure to have trouble.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
